generalInfo: Present in breast milk in low concentrations. Breastfeeding is generally considered compatible, but monitor the infant.

hepaticImpairment.specificInfo: Use with caution. Monitor liver function regularly, especially during the first few months of therapy.

generalInfo: Carbamazepine is associated with teratogenicity, including neural tube defects. Consider specialist advice and monitoring.

renalImpairment.specificInfo: Use with caution in renal impairment. Therapeutic drug monitoring is recommended.

sideEffects.specificInfo: Common: Dizziness; drowsiness; nausea; vomiting; ataxia; blurred vision; dry mouth; fatigue; Hyponatraemia; oedema; headache; thrombocytopenia; leucopenia. Uncommon: tremor; constipation; diarrhoea. Rare: confusion; anaemia; agranulocytosis; lupus-like syndrome; pancreatitis; arrhythmias; hallucinations; rash; interstitial nephritis; Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS); toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN). Frequency Not Known: DRESS syndrome; anaphylaxis; suicidal ideation.
